main event: On 11 May 1958, a yellow-orange object was observed falling in a straight path with a white vapor trail in Saigon, Vietnam.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of the head of a pin.,Witnesses reported an instantaneous disappearance of bright light.,The trail of white vapor rapidly dissipated.,The observation lasted for about 2 seconds.,The sighting was recorded by military personnel.
sighted object: yellow-orange object with a white vapor trail
witness description: Sergeant Donal I. Rondeau, US Marine Corps, and Captain Wilford J. Harris, USAF
